author: Simon Jones For Mailonline
title: Blackburn Rovers consider position of manager Owen Coyle | Daily Mail Online
text: Share 231 shares Akpan, 25, had a goal disallowed for handball and was given a straight red for his excessive protest. He is now facing a hefty suspension. Coyle said: 'We donâ€™t control what decisions are made but three or four huge decisions have gone against us which was beyond belief. Hope Akpan was sent off against Sheffield Wednesday for pushing referee Scott Duncan Akpan, 25, now faces a hefty suspension, forcing Blackburn to block Anthony Stokes' exit 'It is hard to take because of how well the players played tonight and how much the players put into the game.' Blackburn have blocked a move from Polish side Jagiellonia Bialystok to take striker Anthony Stokes on loan. The Polish transfer window remains open until February 28. Coyle faces an uncertain future at Ewood Park as Blackburn face another relegation battle RELATED ARTICLES
